column2: Intuition growing is so out of left field. Can we get something else?

This makes the accolade pretty trivial if you dont avoid all battles.

column2: Easier description accessibility with "keyword" specificity.
column7: For arts descriptions, often other key terms are referenced. If there was a keyword dictionary where a description work matched a reference word, we could provide a quick way to see what it means. It would be especially nice if the descriptions had a "keyword hint" character, such as $ which will signify when such terms are present.
column8: All Arts that refer to effects have part of their generated display the list of the effect. In addition, any general terms that require more definition are also included (such as what constitutes a status ailment)

column2: Formal notification system for Arts and Effects
column7: Until now, Arts and Effects are completely wild-west when it comes to informing the user. I propose that 1) effects have in their database a Start and End message string to let the players know that theyre there or gone and 2) that Arts have a commit and fail message string. The regularity will help prevent confusing situations for new arts and effects and how they play in-game
column8: Arts now have a "greeting" and "fail" message. Effects may or may not "greet" the user, but they will always have an HUD displaying if an effect was gained or lost with details on the effect displayed.
